children.subject: Hey, thanks for the info! I am a sophomore right now

Which year are you in? Unless you got unfavorable grades in 61A and 61B and can't afford anything lower than an A-/B+ in 70, then I would try taking both first and seeing how it goes. Lots of people certainly take this combo. so it is doable. I say this because I have yet to take 16B as a 3rd year and it's getting increasingly difficult to get in as a junior/senior. The way reserved seats for 16B are set up, once you declare CS it becomes difficult to get into the course. Maybe take 70, then wait to declare until you take 16B the next semester if you end up needing to drop 16B?

Also, unless you are itching to declare, you might consider just taking 16B next semester and then 70. You will only be more prepared that way, at the expense of waiting a bit to declare. Best of luck

history.content: Based on a faculty vote to encourage 16A and B being taken in the first two years at Cal, there are very few seats reserved for juniors and seniors in 16B. If this is your second semester sophomore year, you will want to take that into account.

Based on a faculty vote to encourage 16A and B being taken in the first two years at Cal, there are very few seats reserved for juniors and seniors. If this is your second semester sophomore year, you will want to take that into account.

children.subject: You had four semesters during which you would be prioritized to be enrolled. Even if the policy is not ideal -- again, it is the faculty who have set this policy because there was a desire to strongly encourage students to take the course in the first 4 semesters -- it is not completely unreasonable that lower div students would be prioritized for a lower div major requirement. I really hope it works out well for everyone ,and yet people need to accept some personal responsibility for acting as if policies that are in place would not apply to them.

hmmm I guess I am just not agreeing with the idea that I have to take this course in my first two semesters when I chose to take other classes and explore more, but it is not up to me to decide. Regardless, I hope that you guys might look into this rule in the future.

As things stand right now, I cannot even add myself to the waitlist, which I don't understand. Is there any reason why I cannot add myself to the ee16b waitlist at this time? Is it closed or something?

I am having the same problem. I am a 3rd year CS student that did not take ee16b and now it seems I may not be able to graduate because I did not take it earlier. This seems extremely unfair and just frustrating that I do not fall under ANY reserved seats for a CS LOWER DIV major requirement that seems to be a very big class. My two cents is that you guys should look out for some of the older students who did not take the class yet because they have less time left to graduate. I should be able to graduate next semester, but might not be able to because of ee16b.

history.content: Is it a bad idea to take cs 70 + ee16b together in same semester along with philosophy breadth? I need to focus on 70 to declare, so that's where most of my time will be. Am I better off just taking 16b in junior/senior year
history.subject: cs 70 + ee16b
